sentences.en: As baseball commissioner, Chandler was instrumental in making Jackie Robinson the first black player in the major leagues.
sentences.cn: 杰基·罗宾逊成为职业棒球联赛中首位黑人选手，作为棒球协会总干事的钱德勒功不可没。

sentences.en: As he retrieved the money and left, Herbie Chandler's face was a mask of hatred.
sentences.cn: 赫比·钱德勒收起钱走了出去, 怒容满面.

sentences.en: Chandler exacted the flat two dollars daily from each bellboy.
sentences.cn: 钱德勒每天从每个侍者身上榨取足足两块钱.

sentences.en: Chandler reputedly controlled more sideline rackets than anyone else on staff.
sentences.cn: 钱德勒素以比饭店里其他职员有更多的生财之道而闻名.

sentences.en: Chandler's weasel face framed innocent eyes.
sentences.cn: 钱德勒狡猾的脸上露出一副若无其事的神情.

sentences.en: Chandler's weasel face screwed into an obsequious smile.
sentences.cn: 钱德勒黄鼠狼似的脸上现出了谄媚的笑容.

sentences.en: Did you have fun with Uncle Joey and Uncle Chandler today?
sentences.cn: 你今天跟乔伊叔叔还有钱德叔叔玩得开心 吗 ?

sentences.en: He recognized the flat nasal voice of Herbie Chandler.
sentences.cn: 他听出是赫比·钱德勒的低沉而带有鼻音的声调.

sentences.en: I'm speaking from outside the Dorothy Chandler Pavilion, in Los Angeles.
sentences.cn: 我正在洛杉矶,DorothyChandlerPavilion的外面为您解说.

sentences.en: In the best work of Joel Chandler Harris the local becomes universal.
sentences.cn: 在哈里斯最好的作品里,地方性变成了普遍性.

sentences.en: Now Peter supposed he had better see Chandler himself.
sentences.cn: 现在,彼得认为最好还是自己和钱德勒谈谈.

sentences.en: The bell captain, Herbie Chandler, was firmly and unerringly impaled.
sentences.cn: 侍者领班赫比·钱德勒被又稳、又准地抓住了.

sentences.en: The Chandler twins were coming round to the same opinion.
sentences.cn: 钱德勒家的这对双胞胎也最终统一了意见。

sentences.en: The tone was typical Chandler - half fawning, half insolent.
sentences.cn: 这是十足的钱德勒的口气 -- 又是阿谀奉承, 又是傲慢无理.

sentences.en: Who wrote the screenplay from Patricia Highsmith's book? Raymond Chandler, no less.
sentences.cn: 帕特里夏·海史密斯那本书是谁改编成剧本的？雷蒙德·钱德勒呀，厉害。

words.tran_cn: 杂货类；蜡烛店；蜡烛放置处

trans.tran_cn: 船用杂货商（经售绳索、帆布及其他船用物品的商人）
